ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: Correct me if Im wrong, and I usually am. But what I hear is that warriors get lots more hp,s at higher levs, past 20 I belive, And can rangers wear all types
ygData.messageBody:
Correct me if Im wrong, and I usually am.
But what I hear is that warriors get lots more hp,s at higher levs, past 20
I belive,

And can rangers wear all types of armor? have same stamina?Might be true
that ragers kick warrior but at this level.
What interests me though is what it is like at higher levels.

I play a warrior cus I want to be the fat ass barbarian standing in full
plate in the front line suckin it all up.
I want to feel the steel slice through my arms and get beaten to a bloody
pulp, I want to be the guys that keeps the mobs from walkin all over the
party, I want to be the one that dies first but did a damn good job trying
to protect his friends.

If this is possible with a ranger in the same extent as with a warrior,
then I might change.

Vashi, Eternal warriors

>From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>

>This past week I decided to take a break from my level 15 dark elf warrior.
> I was abit frustrated.
>
>I started a half-elf warrior in Kelethin. It is insanely easy to play
>there. I made level 5 in about 3.5 hours. Then I stopped and tried a wood
>elf ranger. Has anyone else played a ranger? I imagine it is the most
>poorly balanced of all the hybrids. After 4 hours I reached level 5 and
>got kick. I am now 12-18 hours into the character and almost level 9. I
>am just as capable as an equivalent warrior. Next level I gain an array of
>spells which will boost my combat effectiveness and allow me to heal. Part
>of the easy success is the plethora of low level orcs available a stone's
>throw from Kelethin. With my tracking ability I am never at a loss for
>targets and I can engage blue con orcs in rapid succession or even 2 at a
>time. I can even engage and successfully beat yellow con orcs more than 50%
>of the time and almost always can kill orcs that con even to me without
>trouble. So far it seems that I get as many hit points now as my warrior
>did.
>
>My point is, with a ranger class as powerful a combatant as it is I see
>little necessity for the pure warrior. I am going to play through to level
>15 I think, just to see a more even comparison. My concern is only from a
>game mechanics perspective though as I have no doubt my playing as a dark
>elf was a much more rewarding experience. Has anyone else noticed that the
>warrior just is not different enough from the hybrid fighter classes?
>
>Bael Aelyn
>Warrior of the 15th Order or Ranger of the 8th Rank
>Indigo Brotherhood Humble Servant of Tunare
>
>still undecided
>
